text:
\[
\sec A - (\sin A)(\tan A) = \frac{1}{\cos A} - \sin A \cdot \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} = \frac{1 - \sin^2 A}{\cos A} = \frac{\cos^2 A}{\cos A} = \cos A
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph performs a specific algebraic manipulation to simplify a part of the expression.
class-2-reason: Applies trigonometric identities and simplifications.

class-1-reason: This paragraph sets up the next step of simplifying the denominator.
class-2-reason: Indicates the result of simplification.

text:
\[
(\tan A)(\sec A - (\sin A)(\tan A)) = \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \cdot \cos A = \sin A
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph simplifies the denominator of the function.
class-2-reason: Simplifies the denominator using previous results.
